summary: My custom ini file for use with Realistic Lighting
descriptionHtml:
Comparison slideshow in the videos section.

NOTE: 1.0.5 and up are for use only with Realistic Lighting 3.31

NOTE: If you use with the Revamped Exterior Fog mod, my ini will NOT look right. Nights will be much brighter, while days are also brighter but with what seems to be much more contrast. You have be warned.

My custom ini file for use with Realistic Lighting. Made a lot of tweaks and am very satisfied with the results. Dark darks, bright brights, and colorful colors. Simple. Stylised realism is what I was aiming for. Screenshots were not taken with nothing but the in-game FXAA and the official HD pack. Goes great with Torches for Realistic Lighting: http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=8741


1.0.1:
Made dusk somewhat brighter.

1.0.2:
Added a small amount of blue into dusk.
Decreased the blue at night by .05 

1.0.3:
Increased targetLum1MultiplierNight by .1
Decreased contrastMultiplierNight by .05

1.0.4:
Decreased greenMultiplierNight by .2

1.0.5:
Only for use with RL 3.31
Increased RGB lines overall for nights, days, interiors, and dungeons

1.0.6:
I take back what I said about no more updates until 1.1 :D
Slightly increased the brightness for interiors to be more realistic.
Very slightly increased the brightness of dungeons.

1.0.7:
Small changes to the overall look of nights
Made interiors and dungeons slightly brighter
Misc changes in \"pointless\" variables

2.0:
Completely redone sunsets
Very slightly less blinding days

2.1:
Pulled back yellow intensity during sunsets 
Polished lighting during sunsets 
Tweaked dungeon lighting/RGB 
Tweaked daytime lighting/RGB

Credit to Sydney666 and Redguard for some baselines.
author: Dinky
